lines.text: GREMIO discovered. Enter behind BIONDELLO, LUCENTIO, and BIANCA

lines.speaker: biondello
lines.text: Softly and swiftly, sir for the priest is ready.

lines.speaker: lucentio
lines.text: I fly, Biondello: but they may chance to need thee at home therefore leave us.

lines.speaker: biondello
lines.text: Nay, faith, Ill see the church o your back and then come back to my masters as soon as I can.
Exeunt LUCENTIO, BIANCA, and BIONDELLO

lines.speaker: gremio
lines.text: I marvel Cambio comes not all this while.
Enter PETRUCHIO, KATHARINA, VINCENTIO, GRUMIO, with Attendants

lines.speaker: petruchio
lines.text: Sir, heres the door, this is Lucentios house: My fathers bears more toward the marketplace Thither must I, and here I leave you, sir.

lines.speaker: vincentio
lines.text: You shall not choose but drink before you go: I think I shall command your welcome here, And, by all likelihood, some cheer is toward.
Knocks

lines.speaker: gremio
lines.text: Theyre busy within you were best knock louder.
Pedant looks out of the window

lines.speaker: pedant
lines.text: Whats he that knocks as he would beat down the gate

lines.speaker: vincentio
lines.text: Is Signior Lucentio within, sir

lines.speaker: pedant
lines.text: Hes within, sir, but not to be spoken withal.

lines.speaker: vincentio
lines.text: What if a man bring him a hundred pound or two, to make merry withal

lines.speaker: pedant
lines.text: Keep your hundred pounds to yourself: he shall need none, so long as I live.

lines.speaker: petruchio
lines.text: Nay, I told you your son was well beloved in Padua. Do you hear, sir To leave frivolous circumstances, I pray you, tell Signior Lucentio that his father is come from Pisa, and is here at the door to speak with him.

lines.speaker: pedant
lines.text: Thou liest: his father is come from Padua and here looking out at the window.

lines.speaker: vincentio
lines.text: Art thou his father

lines.speaker: pedant
lines.text: Ay, sir so his mother says, if I may believe her.

lines.speaker: petruchio
lines.text: [To VINCENTIO]  Why, how now, gentleman! why, this is flat knavery, to take upon you another mans name.

lines.speaker: pedant
lines.text: Lay hands on the villain: I believe a means to cozen somebody in this city under my countenance.
Reenter BIONDELLO

lines.speaker: biondello
lines.text: I have seen them in the church together: God send em good shipping! But who is here mine old master Vincentio! now we are undone and brought to nothing.

lines.speaker: vincentio
lines.text: [Seeing BIONDELLO] Come hither, crackhemp.

lines.speaker: biondello
lines.text: Hope I may choose, sir.

lines.speaker: vincentio
lines.text: Come hither, you rogue. What, have you forgot me

lines.speaker: biondello
lines.text: Forgot you! no, sir: I could not forget you, for I never saw you before in all my life.

lines.speaker: vincentio
lines.text: What, you notorious villain, didst thou never see thy masters father, Vincentio

lines.speaker: biondello
lines.text: What, my old worshipful old master yes, marry, sir: see where he looks out of the window.

lines.speaker: vincentio
lines.text: Ist so, indeed.
Beats BIONDELLO

lines.speaker: biondello
lines.text: Help, help, help! heres a madman will murder me.
Exit

lines.speaker: pedant
lines.text: Help, son! help, Signior Baptista!
Exit from above

lines.speaker: petruchio
lines.text: Prithee, Kate, lets stand aside and see the end of this controversy.
They retire
Reenter Pedant below TRANIO, BAPTISTA, and Servants

lines.speaker: tranio
lines.text: Sir, what are you that offer to beat my servant

lines.speaker: vincentio
lines.text: What am I, sir! nay, what are you, sir O immortal gods! O fine villain! A silken doublet! a velvet hose! a scarlet cloak! and a copatain hat! O, I am undone! I am undone! while I play the good husband at home, my son and my servant spend all at the university.

lines.speaker: tranio
lines.text: How now! whats the matter

lines.speaker: baptista
lines.text: What, is the man lunatic

lines.speaker: tranio
lines.text: Sir, you seem a sober ancient gentleman by your habit, but your words show you a madman. Why, sir, what cerns it you if I wear pearl and gold I thank my good father, I am able to maintain it.

lines.speaker: vincentio
lines.text: Thy father! O villain! he is a sailmaker in Bergamo.

lines.speaker: baptista
lines.text: You mistake, sir, you mistake, sir. Pray, what do you think is his name

lines.speaker: vincentio
lines.text: His name! as if I knew not his name: I have brought him up ever since he was three years old, and his name is Tranio.

lines.speaker: pedant
lines.text: Away, away, mad ass! his name is Lucentio and he is mine only son, and heir to the lands of me, Signior Vincentio.

lines.speaker: vincentio
lines.text: Lucentio! O, he hath murdered his master! Lay hold on him, I charge you, in the dukes name. O, my son, my son! Tell me, thou villain, where is my son Lucentio

lines.speaker: tranio
lines.text: Call forth an officer. Carry this mad knave to the gaol. Father Baptista, I charge you see that he be forthcoming.
Enter one with an Officer

lines.speaker: vincentio
lines.text: Carry me to the gaol!

lines.speaker: gremio
lines.text: Stay, officer: he shall not go to prison.

lines.speaker: baptista
lines.text: Talk not, Signior Gremio: I say he shall go to prison.

lines.speaker: gremio
lines.text: Take heed, Signior Baptista, lest you be conycatched in this business: I dare swear this is the right Vincentio.

lines.speaker: pedant
lines.text: Swear, if thou darest.

lines.speaker: gremio
lines.text: Nay, I dare not swear it.

lines.speaker: tranio
lines.text: Then thou wert best say that I am not Lucentio.

lines.speaker: gremio
lines.text: Yes, I know thee to be Signior Lucentio.

lines.speaker: baptista
lines.text: Away with the dotard! to the gaol with him!

lines.speaker: vincentio
lines.text: Thus strangers may be hailed and abused: O monstrous villain!
Reenter BIONDELLO, with LUCENTIO and BIANCA

lines.speaker: biondello
lines.text: O! we are spoiled andyonder he is: deny him, forswear him, or else we are all undone.

lines.speaker: lucentio
lines.text: [Kneeling]  Pardon, sweet father.

lines.speaker: vincentio
lines.text: Lives my sweet son
Exeunt BIONDELLO, TRANIO, and Pedant, as fast as may be

lines.speaker: bianca
lines.text: Pardon, dear father.

lines.speaker: baptista
lines.text: How hast thou offended Where is Lucentio

lines.speaker: lucentio
lines.text: Heres Lucentio, Right son to the right Vincentio That have by marriage made thy daughter mine, While counterfeit supposes bleared thine eyne.

lines.speaker: gremio
lines.text: Heres packing, with a witness to deceive us all!

lines.speaker: vincentio
lines.text: Where is that damned villain Tranio, That faced and braved me in this matter so

lines.speaker: baptista
lines.text: Why, tell me, is not this my Cambio

lines.speaker: bianca
lines.text: Cambio is changed into Lucentio.

lines.speaker: lucentio
lines.text: Love wrought these miracles. Biancas love Made me exchange my state with Tranio, While he did bear my countenance in the town And happily I have arrived at the last Unto the wished haven of my bliss. What Tranio did, myself enforced him to Then pardon him, sweet father, for my sake.

lines.speaker: vincentio
lines.text: Ill slit the villains nose, that would have sent me to the gaol.

lines.speaker: baptista
lines.text: But do you hear, sir have you married my daughter without asking my good will

lines.speaker: vincentio
lines.text: Fear not, Baptista we will content you, go to: but I will in, to be revenged for this villany.
Exit

lines.speaker: baptista
lines.text: And I, to sound the depth of this knavery.
Exit

lines.speaker: lucentio
lines.text: Look not pale, Bianca thy father will not frown.
Exeunt LUCENTIO and BIANCA

lines.speaker: gremio
lines.text: My cake is dough but Ill in among the rest, Out of hope of all, but my share of the feast.
Exit

lines.speaker: katharina
lines.text: Husband, lets follow, to see the end of this ado.

lines.speaker: petruchio
lines.text: First kiss me, Kate, and we will.

lines.speaker: katharina
lines.text: What, in the midst of the street

lines.speaker: petruchio
lines.text: What, art thou ashamed of me

lines.speaker: katharina
lines.text: No, sir, God forbid but ashamed to kiss.

lines.speaker: petruchio
lines.text: Why, then lets home again. Come, sirrah, lets away.

lines.speaker: katharina
lines.text: Nay, I will give thee a kiss: now pray thee, love, stay.

lines.speaker: petruchio
lines.text: Is not this well Come, my sweet Kate: Better once than never, for never too late.
Exeunt
